description.compact: STASHAPI Constructor

param.description: the API ID
the API PW
the base url (e.g. 127.0.0.1, or https://www.stashbusiness.com) if different from the default
T to generate log messages from STASHAPI functions

description.compact: Returns the constants in the class
Returns a string representation of this object consisting of the API version
Returns the version for this API
Gets the verbosity setting for the STASHAPI instance

return.description: T if verbosity enabled and set in constructor, otherwise F

description.compact: Gets the API ID for the STASHAPI instance

return.description: the API ID

description.compact: Checks the parameter and value for sanity and compliance with rules

param.description: the parameter name => value

return.description: T if all the parameters are deemed valid

description.compact: api_id setter

param.description: your api_id

throws.description: if idIn is invalid or does not match syntax requirements

description.compact: api_id getter

return.description: the API_ID for this instance

description.compact: api_pw setter

param.description: your api_pw

description.compact: api_pw getter

return.description: the API_PW for this instance

description.compact: api_timestamp setter
api_timestamp getter

return.description: the API_timestamp for this instance

description.compact: api_signature setter - signs the request with the current data in the STASHAPI request instance

docblock.description: Uses the following parameters as part of the sig calculation (these are all contained in the $dataIn array as key=>value pairs) - self::params() array containing the request parameters (could be 0 or more key=>value pairs) - ['url'] contains the URL the request is being sent to - ['api_version'] contains the version string for this API - ['api_id'] contains the ID string for the API user - ['api_timestamp'] contains the epoch / integer timestamp for when the request was created

param.description: - an array of key/value pairs containing the data to sign

return.description: T if the function succeeds

comment.value: Must UNESCAPE the slashes so the json_encode here matches encoded json on other platforms

description.compact: api_signature getter

return.description: the API_signature for this instance

description.compact: Function encrypts a string with your API_PW

param.description: the string to encrypt
T if the function should return hexbits instead of raw

return.description: the encrypted string

description.compact: Function decrypts a string with your API_PW

param.description: the string to decrypt
T if the input string is hexbits and should be converted back to binary before decryption

return.description: the decrypted string

description.compact: Function builds and sends an API request

return.description: the result from the curl operation

comment.value: Define the CURL_IGNORE_SSL_ERRORS constant if you want to skip SSL verification (not recommended)

description.compact: Function builds and sends an API download request The result will be stored in a file, specified by $fileNameIn

param.description: the filename to save the downloaded data to

return.description: the result from the curl operation

description.compact: Function builds and sends an API request to upload a file

docblock.description: The input parameters for this function must include a FILE

param.description: the full path and name of the file to upload

return.description: the result from the curl operation

throws.description: if the fileNameIn parameter is empty or the file doesn't exist

comment.value: Define the CURL_IGNORE_SSL_ERRORS constant if you want to skip SSL verification (not recommended)

description.compact: Function builds and sends an API request to upload a file in chunks

param.description: the full path and name of the file to upload
placeholder, not used, for status updates callback
placeholder, not used, for transfer cancellation

return.description: the result from the curl operation

note.value: This function is not implemented and only exists for compatibility with the .Net version of the API

description.compact: Function validates the source identifier parameters

docblock.description: Source identifier can contain fileId, fileName, folderNames, folderId To be valid, a fileId OR (fileName AND (folderId OR folderNames)) must be given If folderOnly is T, then fileId and fileName need not be specified

param.description: T if the validation should be for the source folder only
T if the validation should allow for folderId and/or fileId to be zero and/or the folderId to be -1 (all folders)

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

description.compact: Function validates the destination identifier parameters

docblock.description: To be valid, destFileName AND (destFolderId OR destFolderNames) must be given If folderOnly is T, then destFileName need not be given If nameOnly is T, then destFolderId and destFolderNames need not be given (but folderOnly must be false)

param.description: T if the validation should be for the destination folder only
T if the validate should be for the destination name only, if specified, folderOnly must be false

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

description.compact: Function validates the output type parameters

docblock.description: Source identifier must contain outputType equal to one of the APIRequest::API_OUTPUT_TYPE_X constants

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

description.compact: Function validates the search parameters

docblock.description: Source identifier may contain search and searchPartialMatch values unless $requireTerms is T, then search MUST be specified

param.description: T if the check should error if terms are not specified

return.description: T if the parameters are valid, otherwise exception is thrown

throws.description: if the parameters do not validate

description.compact: Function validates the version parameter

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

throws.description: if the parameters do not validate

description.compact: Function validates the smart folder ID parameter

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

throws.description: for errors with invalid sfId parameter

description.compact: Function validates the overwriteFile parameter and corresponding overwriteFileId parameter, which is required if overwriteFile is specified

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

throws.description: for errors with invalid overwriteFile or overwriteFileId parameters

description.compact: Function validates the check cred parameters

docblock.description: Source identifier can contain fileKey, accountUsername, apiid, apipw

param.description: T if the validation should check fileKey
T if the validation should check accountUsername
T if the validation should check apiid
T if the validation should check apipw

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

description.compact: Function validates the set permissions parameters

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

description.compact: Function validates the check permissions parameters

docblock.description: Source identifier must contain objectUserId, objectId, objectIdType, requestedAccess

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

description.compact: Function validates the WebErase parameters Source identifier must contain token_key and fileKey values

param.description: T if the function should validate only the token_key, otherwise, will also look at fileKey

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

description.compact: Function validates the WebEraseStore function parameters Source identifier must contain token_key, fileKey, and destFolderId values

return.description: T if the parameters are valid

description.compact: Function validates the tag(s) parameters

param.description: if True, will only for presence of 'tag' parameters, otherwise checks for presence of 'tags' parameter

description.compact: Function validates the input parameters before they are passed to the API endpoint

param.description: the operation to check the parameters for

return.description: T if the params are validated, F otherwise

throws.description: if the fileKey parameter is not included in the request

description.compact: Returns the file name for a given path (multi-byte string aware)

param.description: the path and file name

return.description: the file name for a given path

description.compact: Function reads a file from the STASH Vault

param.description: an Associative Array containing the source identifier, values which describe the file to read in the Vault
the file path and name to write the file to in the local filesystem
OUTPUT, the return code returned by the server in the response

return.description: an associative array containing the response from the server

description.compact: Function writes a file to a STASH Vault

param.description: the file name and path to upload to STASH vault
an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of where to write the file in the Vault
the return code in the response
the unique File ID (UserFile) for the newly created file
the unique File ID (UserFileAlias) for the newly created file

return.description: the result / output of the write operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are not valid

comment.value: Check if file exists on the server before uploading it and error if it does (unless overwrite specified)

description.compact: Function writes a file to a STASH Vault in chunks

param.description: the file name and path to upload to STASH vault
an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of where to write the file in the Vault
placeholder, not used, for status updates callback
placeholder, not used, for transfer cancellation
OUTPUT, the return code in the response
OUTPUT, the unique File ID (UserFile) for the newly created file
OUTPUT, the unique File ID (UserFileAlias) for the newly created file

return.description: the result / output of the write operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are not valid

note.value: This function is not implemented and only exists for compatibility with the .Net version of the API

description.compact: Function copies a file in the Vault, creating an entirely new copy, including new files in the storage location(s)

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of where to read the file in the Vault
an associative array containing the destination identifier, the values of where to write the file in the Vault
an integer containing the return code from the request
an integer containing the unique identifier (UserFileAlias) for the file

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are not valid

description.compact: Function renames a file in the Vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of where to read the file in the Vault
associative array containing the destination identifier, the values of the new filename
an integer containing the return code from the request

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function moves a file in the Vault, it does not change the files in the storage location(s)

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of where to read the file in the Vault
an associative array containing the destination identifier, the values of where to write the file in the Vault
an integer containing the return code from the request

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function deletes a file in the Vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which file to delete in the Vault
an integer containing the return code from the request

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function lists all files in the user's vault, or in a specified folder in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which folder to list
an integer containing the return code from the request

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function lists all the files in the Vault or in a specified folder in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which folder to list the files for in the Vault
contains the return code from the operation
contains the names of the files returned by the request

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function lists all the files in a specified SmartFolder

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which folder to list the files for in the Vault
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation
OUTPUT, array of strings, contains the names of the files returned by the request

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function lists all the folders in the Vault or for the specified folder

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which folder to list in the Vault
contains the return code from the operation
contains the names of the folders returned by the request

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function returns the Folder ID of the specified directory, or 0 if not found

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which folder to find the ID for

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

comment.value: Get the Internal Folder ID for the specified directory

description.compact: Function sets a lock on a file in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which file to set the lock on
OUTPUT, the return code from the API call
OUTPUT, the UserFileAlias id of the file the lock was set on

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function gets the lock status on a file in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which file to get the lock status of
OUTPUT, the return code from the API call
OUTPUT, the file lock status (0 = unlocked, 1 = locked)

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function clears the lock on a file in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which file to clear the lock on
OUTPUT, the return code from the API call
OUTPUT, the UserFileAlias id of the file the lock was set on

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function gets the Tags for a file in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which file to get the Tags on
OUTPUT, the return code from the API call
OUTPUT, the tags, as a comma separated string for the file

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function sets the Tags for a file in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which file to set the Tags on
OUTPUT, the return code from the API call
OUTPUT, the UserFileAlias ID for the file the tags were retrieved for

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function adds the specified Tag to a file in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which file to set the Tag on
OUTPUT, the return code from the API call
OUTPUT, the UserFileAlias ID for the file the tags were retrieved for

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function deletes the specified Tag from a file in the vault

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which file to delete the Tag from
OUTPUT, the return code from the API call
OUTPUT, the UserFileAlias ID for the file the tags were retrieved for

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

an associative array containing the destination identifier, the values to rename the folder
OUTPUT - the return code from the API call

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function moves a folder in the vault

an associative array containing the destination identifier, the values to move the folder
the return code from the request

description.compact: Function copies a folder in the vault

an associative array containing the destination identifier, the values of the folder to copy
the return code from the request
the unique identifier for the newly created folder

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

throws.description: if the input parameters are invalid

description.compact: Function checks the provided credentials to make sure the API ID, API PW, username, and account password match a valid account This function generates a failed login if the credentials are not valid for the given user account.

param.description: an associative array containing the source identifier, the values of which credentials to check
OUTPUT, the return code from the operation
OUTPUT, the error message, if one occurred

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are not valid

description.compact: Function checks the provided credentials to make sure the API ID, API PW, username, and account password match a valid account This function generates a failed login if the credentials are not valid for the given user account.

OUTPUT, the return code from the operation
OUTPUT, the error message, if one occurred

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are not valid

description.compact: Function checks the connection to the Vault with the current API settings

param.description: the return code from the operation
the error message, if one occurs

return.description: T if the connection to the vault succeeds, F otherwise

OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation
OUTPUT, contains the result of the permission check (T or F)

param.description: an associative array containing the source and version parameters

param.description: an associative array containing the source and version parameters
the file path and name to write the file to in the local filesystem
OUTPUT, the return code returned by the server in the response

return.description: an associative array containing the response from the server

OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation

param.description: an associative array containing the source and version parameters
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are not valid

description.compact: Function gets the parameters sent by the client and returned/echo'd by the server

param.description: an associative array containing the parameters to send/echo
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation

return.description: the result / output of the operation

throws.description: if the input parameters are not valid

description.compact: Function stores a file using WebErase credentials and WebErase Rules

param.description: the full path and name of the local file to store
an associative array containing the token_key, fileKey, folderId parameters
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation
OUTPUT, contains the UserFile object ID of the newly stored file
OUTPUT, contains the UserFileAlias object ID of the newly stored file
OUTPUT, the one time code to access this file, if one time codes are enabled

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: requires srcIdentifier to have token, folderId, fileName, and fileKey parameters defined

comment.value: Requires token_key, destFolderId, fileKey, projectId, overwriteFile, overwriteFileId

description.compact: Function retrieves a file using WebErase credentials and WebErase Rules

param.description: an associative array containing the parameters needed for the API call
the full path and name to save the downloaded file to
T if the function should poll for a transaction validation retrieval
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: this function only requires the token_key, fileKey, api_id for retrieving a file

comment.value: Params are validated the same for retrieve and polling

description.compact: Function retrieves a file using WebErase credentials and WebErase Rules

param.description: an associative array containing the parameters needed for the API call
the full path and name to save the downloaded file to
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: this function only requires the token_key, fileKey, api_id for retrieving a file

description.compact: Function retrieves a file that's waiting for transaction validation approval

param.description: an associative array containing the parameters needed for the API call
the full path and name to save the downloaded file to
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: this function only requires the token_key, fileKey, api_id for retrieving a file
calling polling API does not trigger a transaction validation notification - it only check for approval or deny; calling webEraseRetrieve() will trigger a new set of notifications

description.compact: Function updates an existing file using WebErase credentials and WebErase Rules

param.description: the full path and name of the local file to update
an associative array containing the token_key, fileKey, folderId parameters
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation
OUTPUT, contains the UserFile object ID of the newly stored file
OUTPUT, contains the UserFileAlias object ID of the newly stored file

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: requires srcIdentifier to have token, folderId, fileName, and fileKey parameters defined

comment.value: Requires token_key, destFolderId, fileKey, projectId, overwriteFile, overwriteFileId

description.compact: Function gets a new token to use with WebErase credentials

param.description: an associative array containing the parameters needed for the API call
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation
OUTPUT, contains a valid token to use in future web erase store operations

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: Only the api_id parameter is needed for this request

description.compact: Function gets the one time code for a given token

param.description: an associative array containing the parameters needed for the API call
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation
OUTPUT, contains the one time code for this token

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: the one time code is sent with the result of a store() or only once with this function regardless of number of times called

description.compact: Function deletes a file using WebErase credentials and WebErase Rules

param.description: an associative array containing the parameters needed for the API call
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: this function requires an api_id and token key to delete the file

description.compact: Function gets a new token to use with WebErase credentials

param.description: an associative array containing the parameters needed for the API call
OUTPUT, contains the return code from the operation

return.description: the result / output of the operation

note.value: Only the api_id parameter is needed for this request

description.compact: Function converts a string of key=value pairs, separated by commas and returns a source or destination identifier compatible array This function handles | characters to separate directory names

param.description: the string to parse

return.description: the converted array for use as source or destination identifier
